In recent updates, a man was critically injured in a hit-and-run in Brooklyn, while NYC's Sanitation Department issued a winter operations advisory ahead of snow. Additionally, Governor Hochul is under pressure to save a health program for 1.7 million New Yorkers amidst various public safety and housing initiatives.

### Risks & Alerts

- Williamsburg hit-and-run: Man critically hurt in Brooklyn crash; police searching for driver. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC Sanitation Department issues winter operations advisory for Sunday snow. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Hiker dies near summit of New York's tallest peak after slipping off trail. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
